sec.title: Introduction
sec.p: The main result is given in Theorem 4.2, and is summarised in Table 1. Remarkably, the existence of a non-trivial invariant generalised Killing spinor implies that all invariant spinors are generalised Killing with the same endomorphism. This makes it possible to carry out computations that depend only on the metric, and not on the choice of a spinor. Moreover, the question whether all invariant spinors are generalised Killing is independent of the choice of left-invariant metric.
